intro: Tabebuia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the pink trumpet tree, is a species of flowering tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The tree typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which can last several months. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture, adding to its visual appeal.
